intro: Serapias lingua var. cordigera, commonly known as the heart-shaped serapias, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rockcress (Brassicaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking yellow flowers with a distinctive hooded structure, typical of the genus Serapias. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in sunny, well-drained habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
